citeinfo.origin: P.A. Moiseev of the Ichthyological Team of the Russian Academy of Science, Institute of Animal Morphology, Ichthyological Team
citeinfo.title: Factors of Population Dynamics of the Commercial Fauna in the Northwest Pacific Ocean

abstract.p: Most of the representatives of the Pacific commercial fauna differ considerably from the corresponding forms which inhabit the Atlantic Ocean in their biology, distribution and behavior. This is caused by a number of specific features of this part of the Pacific Ocean: geological history, relief, water regime, and a number of biotic factors.

[Reference: Moiseev, P.A. 1956. Osobennosti dinamiki chislennosti promyslovoi fauny v severozapadnoi chasti Tikhogo okeana i ee prichiny. Zoologicheskii zhurnal, Vol 35, No 11: pp 1601-1607.] (In Russian)

[Reference: Moiseev, P.A. 1962. Factors of Population Dynamics of the Commercial Fauna in the Northwest Pacific Ocean. Office of Technical Services, U.S. Department of Commerce, Washington, D.C. PST Cat. No. 354. (Published for the National Science Foundation and the Department of Interior, Washington, D.C., U.S.A., by the Israel Program for Scientific Translations Jerusalem.]
A copy of this journal article can be found at the NOAA NMML Library, Seattle, WA.

descript.purpose: To examine factors of population dynamics of commercial fauna in the Northwest Pacific Ocean.
